results.title: Tiger on a tight leash
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Challenge for change/Societe nouvelle”.
Cathy, mother of three, is a university department head in a Canadian city. She speaks of the insecurity she experienced because of unpredictable day care arrangements, and of the reflection of the same difficulty in the work of her married students, who do not work as creatively as they could. One of a group of films about working mothers.

results.title: Tiger hunters
results.creator_credit: Far Eastern Newsreel Studios and V. Goulin
results.brief_description: Some of the tigers trained for Soviet circuses come from the Far East tiger country where they are trapped by groups of skilled hunters. The film shows the hunters, accompanied by dogs, trail their prey which, generally, prefer to elude rather than turn on their pursuers. After the dogs have cornered the tigers the hunters pin them down with forked branches.

results.title: Tiger at the gate
results.creator_credit: Granada Television International and Julia Spark
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “History in action”.
Aldolf Hitler was imprisoned for his part in an abortive military coup in 1924. Released nine months later, Hitler began to rebuild the fragments of the National Socialist Party. At the General Election of 1930, the Nazi Party became the second largest party in the Reichstag. This program profiles the developments that gave Hitler and the Nazi’s popular support, and the means they used to broaden and consolidate their power.

results.title: Tiga
results.brief_description: An animated film by Lucinda Clutterbuck with an original musical score by Paul Schutze. “Tiga” is dedicated to Benjamin, the last Tasmanian Tiger in captivity.
results.description: An animated film by Lucinda Clutterbuck with an original musical score by Paul Schutze. “Tiga” is dedicated to Benjamin, the last Tasmanian Tiger in captivity.

results.title: Tierra
results.creator_credit: Lolafilms SA, Sociedad General de Television SA, Fernando de Garcillan and Julio Medem
results.brief_description: Angel (Carmelo Gomez) arrives in a barren remote village to rid the earth of woodlice that ironically gives the local wine a pleasurable earthly flavour. One of the first things he sees upon his arrival is a Shepard and his sheep struck dead by a lightning bolt. Yet Angel himself harbours a mysterious secret: his earthly presence is haunted by an ethereal one that not only speaks to him from the ‘cosmos’, interrupting his thoughts, but influences his actions. Throughout his stay, Angel meets a modestly beautiful woman, Angela (Emma Suarez), neglected by her husband, Patricio (Karra Elejalde), and the sensuous, highly sexualised, Mari (Silke), with whom Patricio is having an affair. As Angel becomes immersed and entangled in the lives of these characters and others within the village, he is forced to confront his dual personality and the constant battle between body and soul, earth and cosmos. With ‘Tierra’, acclaimed Spanish director Julio Medem has crafted a mystical, visually sumptuous film that suggests sci-fi existentialism, supernatural psychodrama, and fantastic romance, while transcending them all. Medem’s ability to work outside genre and create both a complex and original story is masterful. Ultimately, his thematic exploration of the world of nature and humanity as both driven by powerful forces is metaphysical and surreal, moving and graceful. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Tied Test
results.brief_description: The only tie in test history took place in the first test between Australia and the West Indies in December 1960. The drama and tension that emerged on the final afternoon of the match culminating in what was probably the greatest ever test match.
results.description: The only tie in test history took place in the first test between Australia and the West Indies in December 1960. The drama and tension that emerged on the final afternoon of the match culminating in what was probably the greatest ever test match.

results.title: Tie me up! Tie me down! = Atame!
results.creator_credit: Miramax Films, El Deseo S. A. and Pedro Almodovar
results.brief_description: A satiric and explicit look at the battle of the sexes, examining how a man and a woman relate to each other when they are literally ‘bound’ together. Ricky (Antonio Banderas), a 23 year old ex-psychiatric patient chooses for his wife, Marina (Victoria Abril), a B-grade and porn movie queen with whom he spent a night during one of his many escapes from the institution. But when Ricky visits Marina on the set of her new movie, she doesn’t even recognise him. He figures that his only option is to kidnap her, confident that she will fall in love with him. An audacious and startlingly strangely funny film from Almodovar. Spanish dialogue with English subtitles.

results.title: Tides of Fundy
results.brief_description: A fascinating study of the phenomenal tides in the Bay of Fundy on Canada’s Atlantic coast and how they affect the life of the region.

results.title: Tide pool life
results.brief_description: A study of some of the more usual species of marine life found near rocky shores and the tide pools. Mussels, whelks, sea anenomes, sea urchins and abalone are shown in some detail.

results.title: Tiddalik: based on an aboriginal legend
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Pamela Abbey
results.brief_description: Based on an aboriginal legend, this animated film tells the story of Tiddalik, a greedy frog who drains the world of water, and the efforts of his fellow creatures to replenish the water supply.
